page.title: 05Farming Changes
page.content: It is easier to farm now than years ago because of machinery,chemicals and better seeds.Greenlands farm had lots of animals such as dairy cattle, beef cattle, pigs and sheep which used to take a lot of looking after. Nowadays there is only a herd of Lincoln Red cattle to be reared for market.The farming is mostly arable.The farmer manages over 500 acres of land with only 4 workers and various machines. He has 4 tractors and a combine harvester.He uses fertilisers and sprays against insects and diseases as well as better seeds which all help give a bigger crop. Farming today is a very costly business and he needs to make Â£200 an acre to break even.Some things dont change such as the pattern of rotation the cycle of ploughing, sowing and reaping and of course he still depends a lot on the weather.
